units.title: Treatment of organoids with NOTCH and WNT inhibitors during hormonal stimulation
units.text: were treated with inhibitors to either NOTCH (DBZ or DAPT) or WNT (IWP-2 or XAV939) upon initiation of hormonal stimulation. R-spondin-1 (RSPO-1) was omitted from ExM in the presence of WNT inhibitors.
units.rationale: This describes a precise, actionable protocol step for modulating signaling pathways in organoid culture under hormonal stimulation.

units.title: Collection time points for scRNA-seq
units.text:
Collection time points for scRNA-seq are highlighted with asterisks.
further optimization of the culture conditions to achieve more complete secretory differentiation is under way.
units.rationale: This specifies a critical procedural detail for timing sample collection in single-cell RNA sequencing experiments.

units.title: Use of endometrial organoids to test NOTCH and WNT signaling effects
units.text: Our extensive validation assessing the hormonal responses of the endometrial organoids means that we could use them to test the effects of NOTCH and WNT signaling on epithelial cell fate.
units.rationale: This establishes the functional application of organoids in a defined experimental protocol to probe signaling pathways.
